headline: Auto delinquencies are surging across income levels: VantageScore
summary: Auto loan delinquencies have soared by more than 50% over the last 15 years, according to a new VantageScore report, making them one of the riskiest products for consumer credit scores. VantageScore chief economist Rikard Bandebo sits down with Josh Lipton to talk more about the data and affordability issues in auto loans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Trump’s DOE proposes cutting billions in grants for GM, Ford, and lots of startups
summary: Trump's Department of Energy wants to cancel billions more in awards that were granted by the Biden administration, and startups are in the crosshairs.

headline: Fire at an aluminum plant expected to hit Ford's pickup production
summary: A fire took out a key part of an aluminum plant that supplies sheet to nearly half of the auto industry including Ford, GM and Stellantis.

headline: First North American SPICE Conference Showcases Automotive Excellence, Innovation, and Collaboration
summary: The inaugural North American SPICE (NASPICE) Conference took place September 23–24, 2025, at the Suburban Collection Showplace in Novi, Michigan, bringing together a distinguished assembly of automotive industry leaders, experts, and innovators from North America, Europe, and Asia.
